message.content:
cs.NI, cs.SD, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.IT 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper proposes a novel architecture for Networked Music Performance (NMP) systems that heavily relies on networking principles, specifically Software Defined Networking (SDN). 
2. cs.SD (Software Engineering) - The paper proposes a software-based solution for NMP systems that involves adapting the internal audio signal processing of the application to cope with network delay increase. 
3. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper focuses on NMP systems, which involve live music performance over the Internet, and proposes a solution to provide affordable end-to-end delay to users. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a system-level solution for NMP systems that involves close collaboration between the network and the application to provide ultra-low delay. 
5. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper proposes a solution to cope with network delay increase in NMP systems, which involves adapting the internal audio signal processing of the application. This can be seen as an information-theoretic problem.
